root: ^Sometimes life feels like a never-ending race, but it’s the small steps that get you to the finish line. Do you take the time to appreciate your small victories?

s: ^Not really. I feel like they don’t matter in the long run.
^I try to, but it’s hard when there’s still so much to do.
^Yes, Gran. I celebrate every little step forward.

Dont_Matter: ^They matter more than you realize. Every small step you take builds towards something bigger. What’s one small thing you’ve done recently that you’re proud of?

s: ^I finished a task I’d been putting off for weeks.
^I got through a tough day without giving up.
^I can’t think of anything, Gran. Nothing feels like enough.

Finished_Task: ^That’s wonderful! It may feel small, but overcoming procrastination is no easy feat. Be proud of that—it shows growth.
Survived_Tough_Day: ^Getting through hard days is no small thing. It takes strength to keep going, even when you’re tired. Recognize that strength in yourself.
Nothing_Feels_Enough: ^You’re being too hard on yourself, my child. Even if it feels small to you, it still matters. Take a moment to think about something you’ve done recently—it’s there, even if you don’t see it.
Hard_To_Notice: ^That’s understandable. Life can feel overwhelming, but taking a moment to pause and acknowledge your wins can make a big difference. How do you think you can remind yourself to do that?

s: ^Maybe I could write down my wins at the end of each day.
^I’m not sure, Gran. I’ve never thought about it like that.

Write_Daily_Wins: ^That’s a beautiful idea. Keeping track of your victories will help you see how far you’ve come, even on the hard days.
Never_Thought_About_It: ^That’s okay. Start small—just take a moment at the end of each day to reflect. It doesn’t have to be perfect.
Celebrate_Small_Wins: ^Good! Those small victories will give you the strength to keep moving forward. What’s a win you’re most proud of?

s: ^I worked hard on something, and it paid off.
^I stayed positive, even when things were tough.

Helped_Someone: ^Helping others is one of the greatest victories of all. It shows compassion and strength. Keep doing that—it’ll come back to you.
Hard_Work_Paid_Off: ^That’s the reward of effort. When you put in the work, you earn the satisfaction that comes with it. Don’t stop now.
Stayed_Positive: ^Staying positive is no small feat. It takes courage to hold onto hope when things feel dark. Be proud of that strength.
